ABS.name: Anti-lock Braking System
ABS.description: There is a fault in the ABS system. Your regular brakes will still work, but emergency braking assistance is disabled.
checks: Scan ABS module for fault codes
ABS.action: Drive carefully and have the system inspected as soon as possible.

Airbag.name: Airbag / Supplemental Restraint System
Airbag.description: A fault has been detected in the airbag system. Airbags may not deploy in an accident.
Airbag.action: Seek immediate professional repair. Do not drive if possible.

Battery.name: Charging System Warning
Battery.description: The battery is not being charged or there is a fault in the electrical system.
Battery.action: Turn off unnecessary electrical items and drive to a service station immediately.

Brake.name: Brake System Warning
Brake.description: Serious issue with the braking system or the parking brake is engaged.
checks: Verify parking brake is fully released
Brake.action: Stop the vehicle safely. Check brake fluid level. Do not drive if brakes feel soft.

Check Engine.name: Check Engine / Malfunction Indicator
Check Engine.description: The engine computer has detected a fault in the emission or engine control system.
Check Engine.action: Schedule a diagnostic scan. If flashing, reduce speed and seek immediate service.

Tire Pressure.name: Tire Pressure Monitoring System (TPMS)
Tire Pressure.description: One or more tires have low air pressure.
checks: Measure tire pressures and inflate to spec
Tire Pressure.action: Check tire pressures and inflate to recommended levels.

Coolant Temp.name: Engine Overheating Warning
Coolant Temp.description: The engine is running too hot. Continued driving will cause severe engine damage.
checks: Pull over and let engine cool
Coolant Temp.action: Pull over safely and turn off the engine immediately. Do not open the radiator cap while hot.

Traction Control.name: Traction Control / Stability Control
Traction Control.description: The traction control system is either active or has a fault.
Traction Control.action: Drive cautiously on slippery surfaces. If the light stays on, have it checked.

Seatbelt.name: Seatbelt Reminder
Seatbelt.description: One or more occupants do not have their seatbelts fastened.
Seatbelt.action: Ensure all occupants are buckled up before driving.

Low Fuel.name: Low Fuel Warning
checks: If light stays on, inspect fuel level sensor
Low Fuel.action: Refuel as soon as possible to avoid being stranded.

Oil Pressure.name: Oil Pressure Warning
Oil Pressure.description: Oil pressure is too low. Continued driving can damage the engine.
Oil Pressure.action: Stop the engine and check oil level immediately.

Transmission.name: Transmission Warning
Transmission.description: Transmission temperature or control system issue detected.
Transmission.action: Reduce speed and have the transmission inspected.

Maintenance.name: Maintenance Reminder
Maintenance.description: Scheduled service is due based on mileage or time.
